Luca,

It sounds like something changed in the process of your conversion. 
Are you sure you are using all the same parameters that worked first
in JNEAT? (for example, the neuroevolution parameters)  If so, then it
may be necessary to more closely compare your newer version with the
working version of JNEAT, and see where the difference is.  Some basic
things to check:

-Is your version creating more than one species?  If not, that
indicates a bug in speciation.
-Is your version adding new structure, i.e. are networks getting
bigger?  If not, there may be a bug there.

The reason these questions matter is because it sounds like for some
reason you aren't getting that critical hidden node to appear, which
may be because species aren't being protected, or may be because you
aren't able to add structure for some reason.

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Luca_PI" <wolfgroups@e...> wrote:
> Hi,
> first of all sorry for my english :)
> I have imported JNEAT into J#.NET deleting all the graphic
interface 
> (dir GUI) using it as a DLL and creating the interface in VB.NET.
> I have changed only the Vector in ArrayList.
> After that i try to reproduce the XOR experiment with the original 
> parameter. 
> The result is that the fitness don't go over 6.25 evry time I start 
> the simulation!
> NEAT evolve very fast up to 6.23 (in about 4-5 generation) and
after 
> go step by step near 6.25 until catching up 6.25 in about 13 
> generation. after all it doesn't make nothing.
> I try to increment the epoch value up to 100 with the same result...
> There's a reason to that???
> 
> Thanks for the answers
> Luca
